com.owlike.genson.reflect
Class TypeUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.owlike.genson.reflect.TypeUtil

public final class TypeUtil
extends Object

This class is mainly intended for internal use, however you are free to use it. Be careful as all methods with the additional argument Class inClass will probably be removed in favor of using expandType(Type, Class) and then the method without the additional inClass argument.

Author:
eugen

lookupWithGenerics

public static final Type lookupWithGenerics(Class<?> clazz,
                                            Type parameter,
                                            Class<?> oClazz,
                                            boolean strictMatch)
Regarde si oClazz a implemente une interface de type clazz avec un seul argument generique (le type parameter), par exemple Serializer>

Parameters:
clazz - la classe que l'on cherche (ex Serializer)
parameter - le type generique attendu List
oClazz - - la classe implementant p-e cette interface
Returns:
le type trouve qui en l'occurence serait Serializer> si la classe implemente l'interface Serializer de cette facon, null sinon

match

public static final boolean match(Type type,
                                  Type oType,
                                  boolean strictMatch)
Compare les deux types en profondeur, si ce sont des ParameterizedType on va comparer de facon recursive. On compare les classes avec isAssignableFrom, donc si type est List et oType Collection, cette methode va regarder que les types de type peuvent etre castes en oType. Donc List en Collection et Integer en Number.

Parameters:
type - le type connu
oType - un type qui serait egal ou atteignable a partir de type (voir exemple)
Returns:
vrai ou faux

match

public static final boolean match(Type type,

                                  Type oType,
                                  Class<?> oTypeCtx,
                                  boolean strictMatch)

typeOf

public static final Type typeOf(int parameterIdx,
                                Type fromType)
Searches in the hierarchy of inClass for the parameter type of implementedInterface. For example:
interface MyInterface<T> {}
class MyClass implements MyInterface<Integer> {}
parameterOf(0, MyClass.getGenericInterfaces()[0], MyClass.class)
will return Integer

class MySecondClass<T> implements MyInterface<T> {}
class MyMostSpecificClass extends MySecondClass<Integer> {}
parameterOf(0, MyMostSpecificClass.getSuperclass().getGenericInterfaces()[0], MyMostSpecificClass.class)
will also return Integer

Parameters:
index - of the parameter
implementedInterface - the interface implemented by inClass from which we want to resolve one of the parameters
rootClass - is the interface implementation (maybe declaring the concrete type if interface parameter is a TypeVariable)
Returns:
the resolved type

createParameterizedType

public static ParameterizedType createParameterizedType(Type ofRawType,
                                                        Type inOwnerType,
                                                        Type... withActualTypeArguments)
